amendment.description: To increase public safety by permitting the Attorney General to deny the transfer of firearms or the issuance of firearms and explosives licenses to known or suspected dangerous terrorists.

action.text: Amendment SA 2910 ruled out of order by the chair.
Motion to waive all applicable budgetary discipline with respect to amendment SA 2910 rejected in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 45 - 54. Record Vote Number: 319.
Point of order that the amendment violates section 313(b)(1)(c) of the CBA raised in Senate with respect to amendment SA 2910.

Amendment SA 2910 proposed by Senator Feinstein to Amendment SA 2874. (consideration: CR S8346-8347) To increase public safety by permitting the Attorney General to deny the transfer of firearms or the issuance of firearms and explosives licenses to known or suspected dangerous terrorists.
Roll call votes on amendments in Senate: Motion to waive all applicable budgetary discipline with respect to amendment SA 2910 rejected in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 45 - 54. Record Vote Number: 319.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 2910 proposed by Senator Feinstein to Amendment SA 2874.
